thread.title: Emmerdale's Finn Barton looks set for prison - and fans couldn't be happier: 'He will NOT survive'
thread.title_full: Emmerdale's Finn Barton looks set for prison - and fans couldn't be happier: 'He will NOT survive'

author: Nicola Agius
title: Emmerdale's Finn Barton looks set for prison - and fans couldn't be happier: 'He will NOT survive'
text:
Get soaps updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Emmerdale fans could soon be saying goodbye to Finn Barton. 
In tonight's episode, his ex-boyfriend Kasim had enough of the village bad boy after discovering he'd broken into his house. 
Although he had already been trying to take out a restraining order, he decided further action was now needed to protect himself from Finn. 
So he decided to call the police and press charges against his ex. Emmerdale fans could soon be saying goodbye to Finn Barton (Photo: ITV) 
If found guilty, Finn could face a lengthy prison sentence - and it looks like fans couldn't be happier. 
Taking to Twitter, one wrote: "Finn is just pathetic. What makes it worse, his mate and Mum are DEFENDING him. Ring the cops Kasim and get this nutjob put away. #Emmerdale." 
Another then posted: "#Emmerdale The best way for Kasim to take revenge on Finn is to batter him! Finn deserves that and so much more!" 
Moments later, a different viewer tweeted: "Can't decide who I dislike most at the moment - Pierce or Finn. Too close to call. #Emmerdale." Kasim has reported Finn to the police (Photo: ITV) 
Shortly afterwards, another wrote: "Finn would NOT survive in prison #Emmerdale." 
Is Finn going to go to prison for stalking Kasim? 
Whatever the outcome, he isn't the only Emmerdale favourite facing jail time. Aaron Dingle faces 12 months behind bars (Photo: ITV) 
It's been confirmed Aaron Dingle will be sentenced to 12 months behind bars for attacking Kasim on another occassion. 
And viewers are worried abuot what does this mean for his future with husband-to-be Robert Sugden [Ryan Hawley]? 
*Emmerdale returns to ITV tomorrow at 7pm Like us on Facebook
